name: Colonial and Indian Reception
obverse: Crowned shield of Britain supported by two chains, three shields of the colonies, mantle and rays behind, a motto on ribband below.
obverse_inscriptions: TO COMMEMORATE THE COLONIAL & INDIAN RECEPTION AT THE GUILDHALL
reverse: Interior view of the Guildhall; to the left, a branch of bay with the City mace; to the right, a branch of bay and the City sword. The shield of the City dividing the motto.
description: This is part of the series made by the Corporation of the City of London.
